Package org.micromanager.data

Interface Datastore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, DataProvider
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RewritableDatastore
    public interface Datastore
extends DataProvider
    Read/write access to multi-dimensional image data. Important: Custom Datastore implementations are not supported (consider creating a custom storage instead).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Datastore.SaveMode
      The file format to save to.

    • Method Detail

      • setStorage

        void setStorage​(Storage storage)
        Sets the data storage implementation for this Datastore.
        Parameters:
        storage - data storage to be used henceforth

      • putImage

        void putImage​(Image image)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Insert an image into the Datastore. Posts a NewImageEvent to the event bus.
        Parameters:
        image - Micro-Manager Image object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
        DatastoreFrozenException - if the freeze() method has been called.
        DatastoreRewriteException - if an Image with the same coordinates already exists in the Datastore.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the image's axes do not match the axes of images previously added to the Datastore. All images in a Datastore are required to have the same set of axes in their Coords objects.

      • setSummaryMetadata

        void setSummaryMetadata​(SummaryMetadata metadata)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the SummaryMetadata. Posts a NewSummaryMetadataEvent to the event bus. This method may only be called once for a given Datastore, and must be called before adding any images.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Object representing the summary metadata
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
        DatastoreFrozenException - if the freeze() method has been called.
        DatastoreRewriteException - if the Datastore already has SummaryMetadata or already has images.

      • hasAnnotation

        boolean hasAnnotation​(java.lang.String tag)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Return whether an annotation with the given tag exists.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag for the annotation
        Returns:
        true if the annotation exists; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • getAnnotation

        Annotation getAnnotation​(java.lang.String tag)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Get an annotation, creating it if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        tag - tag for the annotation
        Returns:
        Annotation for th given tag
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • freeze

        void freeze()
     throws java.io.IOException
        Freeze this Datastore so it cannot be further modified.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • setSavePath

        void setSavePath​(java.lang.String path)
        Set the intended path where the data will be stored.

        In the current Micro-Manager file format, this path is used as the enclosing directory.

        Parameters:
        path - the file path (without extension)
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this is an on-disk datastore

      • getSavePath

        java.lang.String getSavePath()
        Get the intended or actual path where the data will be stored.

        If this is an in-memory datastore, returns whatever was set by setSavePath(java.lang.String). If this is an on-disk datastore, returns the actual path.

        Returns:
        the file path where the data is (to be) saved

      • save

        @Deprecated
boolean save​(java.awt.Component parent)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated.
        Use save(Component, boolean) instead
        Deprecated.
        Parameters:
        parent - Window on top of which to display the dialog prompt; may be null.
        Returns:
        true if data was saved; false if user canceled
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • save

        java.lang.String save​(java.awt.Component parent,
                      boolean blocking)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the datastore to an interactively determined path. Opens a file dialog prompting user for a storage location.
        Parameters:
        parent - Window on top of which to display a dialog prompting the user for a location to save. After displaying
        blocking - if true will return after saving, otherwise will return quickly and continue saving on another thread
        Returns:
        Path chosen by user to save the data, null if dialog was canceled
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • save

        void save​(Datastore.SaveMode mode,
          java.lang.String path)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the datastore to the given path using the given format (SaveMode) Will save synchronously (i.e. this function will block)
        Parameters:
        mode - File format to save to
        path - File path used to save the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • save

        void save​(Datastore.SaveMode mode,
          java.lang.String path,
          boolean blocking)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the datastore to the given path using the given format (SaveMode).
        Parameters:
        mode - File format to save to
        path - File path used to save the data
        blocking - when true, will block while saving data, otherwise will return immediately
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • setName

        void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the Datastore. Posts a DatastoreNewNameEvent.
        Parameters:
        name - new name of the Datastore
